definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
Anhui faction of Northern Warlords (1912-c. 1920), led by Duan Qirui 段祺瑞 with Japanese support

sentences.english: The soldiers tied the hands of the defeated king and all of his ministers.
sentences.chinese: 士兵将这位战败国王和他所有大臣的手都绑了起来。

sentences.english: Do the troops who lost the war can still go through the Deshengmen Gate?
sentences.chinese: 战败的军队是否能够通过德胜门入城？

sentences.english: Hehe, how does tiny-weny chicken defeat a gigantic dinosaur for twice?Fair enough.
sentences.chinese: 呵呵，渺小的公鸡怎么两次战败庞大的恐龙？

sentences.english: After Paris fled the field she had the feelings of love and scorn.
sentences.chinese: 帕利斯战败逃离战场后，她的感觉是既爱又卑视。

sentences.english: The defeat of the Persians at Mycale roused the Greek cities of Asia.
sentences.chinese: 波斯人在米卡里的战败唤醒了亚洲的希腊城邦。

sentences.english: The defeat of 1066 signal(1)ed the end of Saxon rule in England.
sentences.chinese: 之战败标志着撒克逊人在英国统治之结束。

sentences.english: The delay lost them the battle.
Mr. Binks: One of my ancestors fell at Waterloo.
sentences.chinese: 我的一个祖先战败在滑铁卢。

sentences.english: Germany and Japan were disarmed after their defeat.
sentences.chinese: 德国和日本战败后，被解除武装。

sentences.english: Galvatron is defeated, but something begins to repair his mind.
sentences.chinese: 惊破天战败，然则某种神秘力量开始修复他受损意识。

sentences.english: After the war, the defeated country was not rearmed by the victors.
sentences.chinese: 战争之后战胜国没有重新武装战败国。

sentences.english: During World War I and later World War II, Bulgaria found itself fighting on the losing side.
sentences.chinese: 在一战期间和二战后期，保加利亚都是处于战败方。

sentences.english: The enemy grew desperate at the defeat.
sentences.chinese: 敌人因战败而拼死挣扎。

sentences.english: Oslash; Galvatron is defeated, but something begins to repair his mind.
sentences.chinese: 惊破天战败，然则某种神秘力量开始修复他受损意识。

sentences.english: After Japan was defeated, Chinese spent years self-destructing.
sentences.chinese: 日本战败后，中国又经历了长年的自我破坏。

sentences.english: Knowing he was defeated, he left feeling shamed.
sentences.chinese: 他知道自己已经战败，羞愧地离开了。

definition: to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
